alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 9:08PM EST until January 05 at 3:09PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Nelson and Hardin Counties. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...From late tonight to Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 32.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday morning to a crest of 35.8 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.8 feet on 11/08/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
